Package auction

Class Auction

  • java.lang.Object
    • auction.Auction
  • public class Auction
extends java.lang.Object
    An auction where people can submit bids for an item. One Auction instance is for bidding on a single item.

    The rules on an auction are:

    1. a person can submit one or more bids with any price > 0 and at least the best bid so far plus a minimum increment If a bid is > 0 but too low then an AuctionError is raised.
    2. New bids must exceed the current best bid by a minimum increment, such as 1 or 0.01. This is specified as a parameter in the constructor.
    3. The application must call auction.start() to enable bidding, and auction.stop() to disable bidding. start() and stop() can be called multiple times. auction.is_active() tests if bidding is enabled.
    4. Bids are allowed only when auction is active. If bid() is called when auction is inactive (stopped), an AuctionError is thrown.
    5. At any time, bestBid() can be called to get best bid so far, and winner() to find name of top bidder.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Auction

        public Auction​(java.lang.String auction_name,
               int min_increment)
        Create a new auction with the given auction name and minimum bidding increment.
        Parameters:
        auction_name - is the name for this auction, such as name of the thing being sold
        min_increment - is the minimum amount that a new bid must exceed the current best bid, should be positive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the minimum increment is less than or equal to 0.

      • Auction

        public Auction​(java.lang.String auction_name)
        Create a new auction with given auction name and min bidding increment of 1.
        Parameters:
        auction_name - is the name for this auction, such as name of item being auctioned

    • Method Detail

      • getAuctionType

        public int getAuctionType()
        Get the auction type, which effects the behavior of the auction. If the auction type has not been set via an environment variable or system proberty or call to setAuctionType, then the default value will be returned.
        Returns:
        the auction type, which effects how the auction behaves

      • setAuctionType

        public void setAuctionType​(int type)
        Set the auction type, which effects some behavior of the auction. This effects some behavior and makes for interesting tests.
        Parameters:
        type - the auction type, should be 1 - 7.

      • start

        public void start()
        Enable bidding in the auction. Use isEnabled to test if bidding is enabled.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Disallow bidding in the auction. Use isEnabled() to test if bidding is enabled.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Query if bidding is enabled for this auction.
        Returns:
        true if bidding enabled, false if bidding is disabled.
        See Also:
        start(), stop()

      • bid

        public void bid​(java.lang.String bidder_name,
                double amount)
        Submit a bid to this auction.
        Parameters:
        bidder_name - name of bidder, a non-empty, non-blank string. Names are converted to Title Case, and excess space inside and surrounding the string is removed. For example, " harry potteR " is normalized to "Harry Potter"
        amount - is amount to bid. It must be positive and greater than previous best bid by at least a minimum bid increment, as set in the Auction constructor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if bidder_name or amount are have invalid values.
        AuctionError - if bidding is disabled or bid amount is too low

      • bestBid

        public double bestBid()
        Return the highest bid received so far.
        Returns:
        the best bid so far. 0 if no bids yet.

      • winner

        public java.lang.String winner()
        Return the name of person who places the highest bid received so far.
        Returns:
        name of the person who submitted the best bid
        See Also:
        bestBid()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a description of the auction.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        description of the auction

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        main doesn't do anything useful.

        args - not used.
